e4: As a board member, my primary responsibility is to act in the best long-term interests of ABC and its stakeholders.  Continuing to overreport earnings, even if investors anticipate it, sets a dangerous precedent and undermines trust. While there will be challenges in transitioning to an unbiased reporting system, the ethical imperative to present accurate financial information outweighs those concerns. Maintaining integrity is crucial for sustainable success.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy above all else. It presents unbiased financial information, clearly disclosed and readily understandable to stakeholders.  Considerations include adhering to regulatory standards, fostering trust with investors, and maintaining a culture of integrity within the organization. Short-term gains should never supersede long-term ethical responsibility.
e6: Yes. I'd ask about their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, addressing potential concerns and highlighting the commitment to transparency.  Additionally, I'd inquire about any mechanisms in place to ensure ongoing monitoring and adherence to the new ethical reporting standards.
